definition: to disfigure/to spoil the beauty of
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: The two pieces were indeed see money undoubtedly disfigured, believe her words.
sentences.chinese: 冢本見錢二的確被毀容無疑，相信了她的話。

sentences.english: Face lane after disfiguring, another no an dared apt come apt her this pure Quan Yuan to"act boorishly".
sentences.chinese: 臉弄毀容後，就再沒有人敢來她這清綣苑“撒野”了。

sentences.english: Again, one of the difficulties of seeing him close-up is that the final revelation of his disfigurement is not particularly startling or frightening.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，他在最後被發現毀容的近鏡並不嚇人或恐怖。
毀容的手現在已經很罕見。

sentences.english: There are certain disfiguring and mortal diseases about which there has probably never been any snobbery.
sentences.chinese: 也許對某些毀容或致命地疾病從來沒有使人感到勢利。

sentences.english: The victim is badly disfigured and possibly brain-damaged.
sentences.chinese: 受害者已嚴重毀容且大腦可能收到損壞。

sentences.english: Somehow, we are all complicit in her ruination .
sentences.chinese: 也不知怎的，我們每人都是她毀容的幫兇。

sentences.english: Lucas considered having a scene where Luke’s face gets injured.
sentences.chinese: 盧克斯考慮要一個場景，盧克的臉被毀容。

sentences.english: The disfigurement of his face was caused by an explosion.
sentences.chinese: 他面部的毀容是由於一次爆炸造成的。

definition: to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to prescribe medicine/to poison/to slip a drug (into sb's drink etc)
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to denature/denaturation/to have a sex change/transsexual
